content.question: What is the area of the region bounded by the graph of the polar curve <math alttext="r equals, the square root of 1 plus the fraction 3 over pi, end fraction, times theta" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><msqrt><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow></mfrac><mi>θ</mi></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis for <math alttext="0 less than or equal to theta, less than or equal to pi" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo>≤</mo><mi>π</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

unit.text: 9: Parametric Equations, Polar Coordinates, and Vector-Valued Functions

topic.text: 9.9: (BC ONLY) Finding the Area of the Region Bounded by Two Polar Curves

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
